verses.plain: Hold not thy peace, O God of my praise;

tokens.t: Hold not thy peace, O God of my praise;

verses.plain: For the mouth of the wicked and the mouth of the deceitful are opened against me: they have spoken against me with a lying tongue.

tokens.t: For the mouth of the wicked and the mouth of the deceitful are opened against me: they have spoken against me with a lying tongue.

verses.plain: They compassed me about also with words of hatred; and fought against me without a cause.

tokens.t: They compassed me about also with words of hatred; and fought against me without a cause.

verses.plain: For my love they are my adversaries: but I give myself unto prayer.

tokens.t: For my love they are my adversaries: but I
prayer.

verses.plain: And they have rewarded me evil for good, and hatred for my love.

tokens.t: And they have rewarded me evil for good, and hatred for my love.

verses.plain: Set thou a wicked man over him: and let Satan stand at his right hand.

tokens.t: Set thou a wicked man over him: and let Satan stand at his right hand.

verses.plain: When he shall be judged, let him be condemned: and let his prayer become sin.

tokens.t: When he shall be judged, let him be condemned: and let his prayer become sin.

verses.plain: Let his days be few; and let another take his office.

tokens.t: Let his days be few;
let another take his office.

verses.plain: Let his children be fatherless, and his wife a widow.

tokens.t: Let his children be fatherless, and his wife a widow.

verses.plain: Let his children be continually vagabonds, and beg: let them seek their bread also out of their desolate places.

tokens.t: Let his children be continually vagabonds, and beg: let them seek
also out of their desolate places.

verses.plain: Let the extortioner catch all that he hath; and let the strangers spoil his labour.

tokens.t: Let the extortioner catch all that he hath; and let the strangers spoil his labour.

verses.plain: Let there be none to extend mercy unto him: neither let there be any to favour his fatherless children.

tokens.t: Let there be none to extend mercy unto him: neither let there be any to favour his fatherless children.

verses.plain: Let his posterity be cut off; and in the generation following let their name be blotted out.

tokens.t: Let his posterity be cut off;
in the generation following let their name be blotted out.

verses.plain: Let the iniquity of his fathers be remembered with the LORD; and let not the sin of his mother be blotted out.

tokens.t: Let the iniquity of his fathers be remembered with the
; and let not the sin of his mother be blotted out.

verses.plain: Let them be before the LORD continually, that he may cut off the memory of them from the earth.

tokens.t: Let them be before the
continually, that he may cut off the memory of them from the earth.

verses.plain: Because that he remembered not to shew mercy, but persecuted the poor and needy man, that he might even slay the broken in heart.

tokens.t: Because that he remembered not to shew mercy, but persecuted the poor and needy man, that he might even slay the broken in heart.

verses.plain: As he loved cursing, so let it come unto him: as he delighted not in blessing, so let it be far from him.

tokens.t: As he loved cursing, so let it come unto him: as he delighted not in blessing, so let it be far from him.

verses.plain: As he clothed himself with cursing like as with his garment, so let it come into his bowels like water, and like oil into his bones.

tokens.t: As he clothed himself with cursing like as with his garment, so let it come into his bowels like water, and like oil into his bones.

verses.plain: Let it be unto him as the garment which covereth him, and for a girdle wherewith he is girded continually.

tokens.t: Let it be unto him as the garment
covereth him, and for a girdle wherewith he is girded continually.

verses.plain: Let this be the reward of mine adversaries from the LORD, and of them that speak evil against my soul.

tokens.t: this
the reward of mine adversaries from the
, and of them that speak evil against my soul.

verses.plain: But do thou for me, O GOD the Lord, for thy name’s sake: because thy mercy is good, deliver thou me.

tokens.t: But do thou for me, O
the Lord, for thy name’s sake: because thy mercy
good, deliver thou me.

verses.plain: For I am poor and needy, and my heart is wounded within me.

tokens.t: For I
poor and needy, and my heart is wounded within me.

verses.plain: I am gone like the shadow when it declineth: I am tossed up and down as the locust.

tokens.t: I am gone like the shadow when it declineth: I am tossed up and down as the locust.

verses.plain: My knees are weak through fasting; and my flesh faileth of fatness.

tokens.t: My knees are weak through fasting; and my flesh faileth of fatness.

verses.plain: I became also a reproach unto them: when they looked upon me they shaked their heads.

tokens.t: I became also a reproach unto them:
they looked upon me they shaked their heads.

verses.plain: Help me, O LORD my God: O save me according to thy mercy:

tokens.t: Help me, O
my God: O save me according to thy mercy:

verses.plain: That they may know that this is thy hand; that thou, LORD, hast done it.

tokens.t: That they may know that this
thy hand;
thou,
, hast done it.

verses.plain: Let them curse, but bless thou: when they arise, let them be ashamed; but let thy servant rejoice.

tokens.t: Let them curse, but bless thou: when they arise, let them be ashamed; but let thy servant rejoice.

verses.plain: Let mine adversaries be clothed with shame, and let them cover themselves with their own confusion, as with a mantle.

tokens.t: Let mine adversaries be clothed with shame, and let them cover themselves with their own confusion, as with a mantle.

verses.plain: I will greatly praise the LORD with my mouth; yea, I will praise him among the multitude.

tokens.t: I will greatly praise the
with my mouth; yea, I will praise him among the multitude.

verses.plain: For he shall stand at the right hand of the poor, to save him from those that condemn his soul.

tokens.t: For he shall stand at the right hand of the poor, to save
from those that condemn his soul.

footnotes.text: of the deceitful: Heb. of deceit
are opened: Heb. have opened themselves
be condemned: Heb. go out guilty, or, wicked
into his bowels: Heb. within him
